summary:
Real Madrid 3 - 0 Almeria: A Thorough Breakdown of the Match

On an electrifying evening at the Santiago Bernabéu, Real Madrid displayed a commanding performance to secure a dominant 3-0 victory over Almeria. The match, characterized by Real Madrid's characteristic attacking prowess and Almeria's sporadic resilience, saw an enthralling array of events that captivated the spectators throughout the 90 minutes of play.

The match kicked off promptly at 00:00 with Real Madrid immediately asserting their possession. Within the first minute, the ball was out of play, but Real Madrid quickly regained control with a throw-in at 00:40. Almeria's aggressive approach was evident early on, as they committed a foul at 01:58, leading to an indirect free-kick for Real Madrid at 02:09. The home team capitalized on this set-piece opportunity, although it didn't yield a notable attempt on goal immediately. 

It was clear that Real Madrid were keen to make their mark early in the match. In the fourth minute, they won a corner (06:40) which soon led to a shot off target (03:44), demonstrating their intention to press high and apply pressure on Almeria’s defense. Real Madrid continued to bombard Almeria's goal, with a commendable effort on target coming at 06:15, only to be thwarted by the defense and the ball swiftly cleared.

The ebb and flow of the game persisted with both teams exchanging possessions, committing fouls, and contesting aerial duels. Almeria tried to find their feet when Mane and Corona made forward connections, but Real Madrid’s defense, especially players like Pepe and Alvaro Arbeloa, were resolute in their backline duties. Notably, Ronaldo’s early effort to link up with Chicharito was intercepted by the Almeria defense, encapsulating the defensive solidity of the visitors (10:43).

Despite Almeria’s attempts to penetrate Real Madrid's defenses through crosses from Mane and Corona, they failed to deliver on these opportunities as the Real Madrid defenders cleared their lines (11:40). A golden opportunity arose for Real Madrid when James Rodriguez sent over a cross, which was once again neutralized by Almeria (12:49). Almeria, eager to match Real Madrid's tempo, produced a notable effort when Corona unleashed a long-range shot, only for it to ricochet off a defender for a corner (13:46). Mane also dazzled with his dribbling to unleash a shot, which narrowly missed (14:56).

As the first half progressed, Real Madrid maintained a higher possession percentage and continued to create scoring opportunities. Mane's effort at a cross from a tricky angle was commendable but intercepted by Real Madrid. Similarly, Fabio Coentrao of Real Madrid did not relent as he tried to find his teammates, only to be thwarted by Almeria’s resilient defense. An early breakthrough seemed inevitable, particularly after Cristiano Ronaldo’s near-miss free-kick attempt in the 27th minute that whizzed just over the crossbar (27:27).

The game remained goalless until the dying minutes of the first half when a crucial event changed the dynamics. Around the 44th minute, the relentless pressure from Real Madrid finally paid off. From a corner, the ball eventually found James Rodriguez, whose powerful shot from outside the box was unstoppable and found the top corner of the net, changing the score to 1-0 in favor of Real Madrid. This breakthrough was vital, setting an assertive tone for the remainder of the match (44:00).

The first half came to a close at 45:18, with Real Madrid heading to the locker room with a well-deserved lead. The spectators were treated to an enthralling 45 minutes, witnessing numerous attempts, solid defending, and a spectacular goal to cap it off.

The second half resumed with Almeria in possession. Despite their efforts, they failed to build any substantial attacking opportunities early on. Real Madrid's Toni Kroos delivered a cross that tested Almeria’s backline almost immediately after the restart (00:51). Almeria's fleeting moments came through Thomas and Mane, who tried to break through Real’s defense but found Keylor Navas alert and intercepting crosses (02:45).

It didn’t take long for Real Madrid to double their lead. Upon receiving a corner in the 3rd minute, a mishap by Almeria's Mauro Dos Santos saw an own goal occur, extending Real Madrid’s lead to 2-0 (03:31). This unfortunate event for Almeria underscored Real’s supremacy and added further confidence to the home team's playstyle.

Despite being two goals down, Almeria continued to fight back. Edgar Mendez’s aggressive challenge in the 5th minute led to a free kick for Real Madrid, further showcasing the visitors' desperate attempts to regain their footing (05:50).

Real Madrid dominated possession and continued to attack with vigor, as Jese and Kroos became central figures in constructing forward plays. Almeria, attempting to capitalize on set-pieces, failed to get a grip on the game as Real Madrid's defense and midfield worked harmoniously to neutralize threats. This persistent effort bore fruit with another substitution for Almeria — Edgar Mendez made way for Jonathan Zongo in the 12th minute, indicating Almeria's attempt to rejuvenate their attack strategy (12:56).

With their firm control of the game, Real Madrid introduced fresh legs around the 20th minute of the second half. James Rodriguez was replaced by Isco and Asier Illarramendi made way for Lucas Silva, further strengthening their midfield dynamics (19:42, 19:59).
